question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Floating point non-determinism] Can parallel execution introduce non-deterministic rounding in gas calculations or Move arithmetic operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Timestamp dependency] Does execute_single_transaction() read system timestamps, and can parallel execution cause different validators to see different times? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Randomness source] If transactions use random number generation, can parallel execution produce different random streams across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State root mismatch] After parallel execution completes, is there validation that all validators computed the same final state root, or can divergence go undetected? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Transaction provider trust] Line 56 blindly trusts txn_provider.get_txns() - can an attacker inject malicious transactions, duplicate transactions, or reordered transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Signature verification bypass] SignatureVerifiedTransaction type suggests signatures are pre-verified, but is there re-verification, or can corrupted signatures pass through? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Transaction count validation] Is there a maximum transaction limit enforced, or can an attacker submit enormous blocks causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Duplicate transaction] Can the same transaction appear multiple times in get_txns(), and would parallel execution detect and reject duplicates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Code storage race] Line 62 creates new code_storage per transaction - can this cause race conditions when loading the same module concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Stale module cache] Can parallel threads see inconsistent module versions if state_view is updated during execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Module upgrade race] If a transaction publishes a new module version, can subsequent parallel transactions use the wrong version? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Log injection] AdapterLogSchema on line 61 uses state_view.id() and txn_idx - can an attacker manipulate these to inject false log entries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Timer manipulation] BLOCK_EXECUTOR_INNER_EXECUTE_BLOCK timer on line 40 - can timing measurements leak sensitive execution patterns or enable timing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Resolver consistency] Line 66 creates vm.as_move_resolver(state_view) per transaction - can this create isolated resolver instances that miss cross-transaction dependencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State isolation] Does each parallel transaction see a snapshot of state, or can writes from concurrent transactions become visible mid-execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Read-after-write] Can a transaction read state that was modified by a parallel transaction, violating snapshot isolation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Output ordering] BlockOutput::new() on line 80 receives transaction_outputs - are these guaranteed to be in the same order as input transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Epilogue position] Line 82 sets epilogue as Some(block_epilogue_txn) - is this always the last transaction, or can parallel execution reorder it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/native/aptos_vm_uncoordinated.rs] [Function: new()] [Stateless executor] AptosVMParallelUncoordinatedBlockExecutor has no internal state (line 30) - is this safe, or should it maintain execution context? (Low)
